Located centrally in the best part of the city, do come to enjoy the hospitality of the Prasad Family.

text.text:
I checked in today for a two-night stay in their suite with a bathtub. My flight landed at 7 AM, and I had already spoken to the hotel beforehand requesting an early check-in. Unfortunately, despite the room being vacant, we were made to wait two hours before being given the keys. I understand hotel policies may not allow early check-in more than four hours before standard time, but what was disappointing was that even during those two hours in the lobby, it took them an hour just to serve us a glass of water.

The suite itself is spacious, with two bathrooms, a sitting area, and a bedroom. However, I learned that the property is 15 years old, and it shows. The room has wooden paneling on all walls, but the storage space is limited—just one cupboard, which is inadequate for even two people. The mattress was slightly smaller than the bed, affecting the aesthetics. The room had a musty smell, like it hadn’t been aired out in a while. The bathroom is large with a bathtub, but the fittings, mirror, and toilet look old and in need of replacement. There was no hot water during my first day. The French windows in both the bedroom and sitting area have visible water stains, which affect the view. Outside the room, the passageway has water dripping from the roof, possibly from AC vents.

I requested a room freshener to deal with the musty smell, but it never arrived. The reception staff were polite but not particularly warm—everything was handled in a matter-of-fact way without much hospitality.

On the positive side, the location is excellent—right in the Hazratganj area, close to all major tourist spots in Lucknow. I’ve only stayed one night so far, so let’s see how tomorrow goes.

text.text:
Great location and well-designed rooms — the bathrooms were clean and had all the essentials. That’s where the good part ends.

The staff was rude and completely unwelcoming, which really ruined the experience.From the moment we checked in, there was this coldness — no warmth, no sense of hospitality. It genuinely felt like they were doing us a favour by letting us stay there. On top of that, there were frequent power cuts, and no one seemed bothered or apologetic about it.

For the price and reputation, I expected basic courtesy and smoother service. Disappointed.
It’s frustrating because the property has potential. But if you're looking for a pleasant, smooth, and welcoming experience — I’d suggest looking elsewhere unless they seriously work on their service and basic infrastructure.

text.text:
I am writing to express my disappointment with my recent experience at Regenta Central Lucknow, which marks the second time I have felt let down by your services.
During this stay, I faced significant inconvenience due to non-functional air conditioning. Despite changing rooms three times, I was not provided a room with a properly working AC:

Room 4115 – AC was completely non-functional.

Room 4114 – AC not cooling, no fridge, broken mirror, faulty flush, and several non-working lights.

Room 4112 – AC worked for about 2 hours and then stopped cooling altogether.

While the staff was courteous and tried to be supportive, they were unable to resolve the issue. I now understand why each room has a ceiling fan — seemingly to compensate for malfunctioning AC units, which is not expected at this price point or standard of service.

This follows an earlier disappointing experience:
Last year, I had to cancel my booking due to a sudden family emergency. I had informed the management in good faith and was verbally assured a credit for a future stay, with no terms discussed at the time. However, when I reached out 10 months later to utilize that credit, I was told that the credit validity was only 3 months — a condition that was never communicated earlier. Despite multiple requests, not even a complimentary meal was offered as a goodwill gesture.

Both experiences reflect poorly on guest service and post-booking support. I hope you will take this feedback seriously and work toward improving both the maintenance of your property and transparency in guest communication.

text.text:
I recently stayed at Regenta Central, Lucknow, and while I truly appreciated the hospitality and responsiveness of the staff, I feel compelled to point out some issues that need urgent attention.

We had booked the **Royal Suite**, but unfortunately, the **AC wasn’t working**. I requested the staff to look into it, and they tried their best, but eventually had to **shift us to another room**. The new room was quite nice, with good interiors and overall ambiance — but the **AC again was not up to the mark**.

Additionally, **hot water wasn’t available in the tap**, and even after waiting for a long time, it didn’t work properly. While we visited in the summer, I can only imagine how inconvenient this would be in winter.

Again, I want to **emphasize that the staff was very courteous and helpful** — they are doing a commendable job with the resources available to them. The issues seem to be related to **infrastructure and maintenance**, which I hope the hotel management or higher authorities will address soon.

This place has great potential, but it urgently needs **renovation and better facilities** to truly offer a comfortable experience.

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and, unfortunately, it fell short of expectations. Despite being advertised as a 5-star property, it felt more like a 3-star hotel in almost every aspect. The rooms were quite small, and the amenities were minimal. The TV didn’t have a cable connection throughout our stay, despite multiple requests to fix it. Breakfast was very average with limited variety and taste.

Overall, the experience was underwhelming, and you can easily find a similar or better experience at a good 3-star hotel, likely at a lower price. Would not recommend if you’re expecting true 5-star standards.

Orchid restaurant @Fortune Hotel Jopling Road is a fine dine restaurant for in house hotel guests as well as open to outside diners as well.
We went in group for weekend lunch to this restaurant which serves both Indian as well as Continental stuff.
This time we all wanted to have Continental stuff and particularly the grill platters.We ordered Grilled chicken,Grilled Paneer and Grilled Fish platters.
The food was good and the chicken platter stood out with mashed potatoes and dip.
The Grilled paneer was slightly bland and required some extra salt and black pepper as per our taste, though cooked well.
The meal was washed with peach ice tea.
A hearty meal!

text.text:
Hey foodies! Today, I’m at Zaika Restaurant by Gemini Continental in Lucknow, and let me tell you, this place has the best buffet spread you could ever imagine! We're talking about over 60 dishes, and it’s not just a meal; it’s a whole experience!😍

First off, the interiors here are absolutely stunning—luxury and royal vibes all around. You walk in and feel like you’re in a different world!🫶🏻

Now, let’s dive into the buffet. It kicks off with 6+ varieties of starters, both veg and non-veg. My top picks? The chicken tikka is to die for, the paneer spring rolls are crispy perfection, and you’ve got to try the mutton galawati kebab—it’s served right at your table! Talk about service!😇

And don’t miss the live counters! They’ve got dosa, pasta, and waffles being made fresh just for you. How cool is that?🤤

When it comes to the main course, you have more than 25 items to choose from! I’m talking about mutton korma, bhuna keema, kadhai paneer, dal makhni—seriously, it’s a feast! And if you’re in Lucknow, you can’t skip their awadhi biryani. Trust me; it’s a must-try!😌

Now let’s chat about dessert. The options are endless! Whether you’re a chocolate lover or into traditional sweets, they’ve got something for everyone.🥵

So if you're looking for an unforgettable buffet experience in Lucknow, Zaika Restaurant is where you need to be. Come hungry because this is not just a buffet; it’s an experience that will leave you wanting more!❤️

The hotel is housed in a period building with some of the features and facets retained to give an antique look to the hotel.  The location is close to  major attractions like  the Imam bargah and the beautiful  Rumi gate.

We had breakfast on two mornings and the a la carte breakfast was tasty, sumptuous and value for money.

I would recommend this property wholeheartedly to anyone visiting Lucknow

text.text:
I had a deeply disappointing experience at Charan Plaza, Lucknow. The service was extremely poor — the staff appeared completely untrained and disinterested in basic customer service. Simple requests were ignored or mishandled, and there was a clear lack of coordination and professionalism.

To make matters worse, the food served was not only substandard but also stale. It lacked freshness, taste, and hygiene — completely unacceptable by any standard. It’s clear that quality control is not a priority here.

Overall, the entire experience felt like a complete letdown. I would strongly advise others to consider alternative venues in Lucknow that value their customers and maintain basic service and food standards.

text.text:
**Restaurant Review - ⭐⭐⭐ (3/5)**

I recently visited this restaurant for their buffet, and overall, it was an **okay-okay** experience. The variety was decent, but as a vegetarian, I was a bit disappointed with the starters. They were not as good as expected—some lacked flavor, and a few felt a bit stale.

The main course was **better**, with a few good options, but nothing extraordinary. Desserts were **probably the best part**, offering a nice way to end the meal. The service was average, and the ambiance was decent.

If you’re looking for a **budget-friendly buffet**, it might be worth a try, but don't expect anything exceptional, especially for vegetarians.

Building is quite conjusted and old construction. It's in the third floor. We got a the corner most room and it was crampy. The bed was biggest negative point. Literally they put some old mattress on a old stand which is like making s big whole in the centre when you sleep or even sit. The AC was loud and old which was throwing bad smell in this July rainy season. The bathroom was totally no no. The Easter seat of the toilet is literally in the corner of the building so close to the wall that you can't sit on it properly. Cupboard doesn't had any hangers. Although the complimentary breakfast was good( Aloo paratha). So the access wise it's good but to stay would pass on it next time.

text.text:
The hotel is conveniently located very close to Lucknow Station, making it a good choice for travelers. The rooms are decent and comfortable overall. However, they do charge extra for early check-in and late check-out, which could be a downside for some.

The main drawback is the lack of proper maintenance—towels were not fully clean, the geyser and toilet flush weren’t functioning properly, and one room had no TV service due to an expired Tata Sky subscription. Even a single bottle of water is chargeable. With improved upkeep and attention to guest comfort, this hotel could offer a much better experience.

text.text:
I recently stayed at Hotel Nexus, Lucknow, and overall, it was a pleasant experience. The hotel is conveniently located just 700 meters from the railway station, making it a great choice for travelers looking for easy access.

The cleanliness of the hotel is commendable, with well-maintained rooms and common areas. The staff behavior was very polite and professional, always ready to assist with any requests. Room service was also efficient, ensuring a comfortable stay.

One minor issue we faced was that the TV in our room was not working on the first day, but upon informing the management, they promptly replaced it, which was a positive response. The only downside was that the food prices seemed a little high, though the quality was decent.

Overall, Hotel Nexus is a good option for those looking for a clean and comfortable stay near the station, with friendly staff and decent services. Just keep in mind the food pricing if you’re planning to dine in.

text.text:
My stay at this hotel was an absolute nightmare. From the moment we arrived, it was clear that cleanliness and guest comfort were not priorities. The room had not been cleaned after the previous guests, with unmade beds and unchanged sheets. When we requested fresh linens, we were told the laundry staff wasn’t available, so nothing could be done immediately. The washrooms were in a filthy state, yet despite raising concerns, no effort was made to address the issue.

To make matters worse, the room boy, Vikas, was incredibly rude and behaved as if he had more authority than the manager. Instead of addressing our concerns, he had the audacity to say, 'Ma’am, you may check out if you're not satisfied.' Things escalated when he snatched the keys from us and even went as far as threatening to lock us in the room if we didn’t leave. In an unfamiliar location, this was not just unprofessional but outright dangerous. How can guests feel safe in a place where employees behave this way?

The level of unprofessionalism, lack of hospitality, and outright hostility were beyond anything I’ve ever experienced. I would strongly advise against staying here unless serious changes are made to both the staff and management.

text.text:
Hotel Vills offers budget-friendly accommodations in Lucknow, making it a solid choice for travelers looking for spacious rooms at an affordable price. The rooms are well-maintained and provide ample space, ensuring a comfortable stay. The location is convenient, though it comes with its challenges.

One drawback is the lack of dedicated parking. Guests have to park their vehicles on the road, which is narrow and allows only one car to pass at a time. This can be inconvenient, especially if another vehicle approaches from the opposite direction, as it requires reversing to make way.

The property has been converted from a house into a guest house, but the transformation has been handled well. It retains a cozy, homely vibe while offering the services expected in a hotel. The staff is courteous and attentive, which adds to the positive experience.

Overall, Hotel Vills is a great option for budget-conscious travelers who prioritize spacious rooms and good service over parking convenience.

editorialSummary.text: Down-to-earth rooms in a laid-back lodging offering dining & event space, plus free breakfast.

text.text:
I had heard rave reviews about this place, which set high expectations for my visit.

Ambiance: The ambiance is generally good.

Service: However, the service was slow, taking 30-35 minutes to serve the food. If you forget to order something and try to add it later, be prepared for another 10-15 minute wait.

Food: As someone who has dined at some of the best restaurants in Lucknow, I was underwhelmed by the food served here. It didn't meet my expectations in terms of taste. That being said, I did enjoy the fish tikka, which was part of the non-vegetarian cuisine I ordered.

Location: On the plus side, the location is convenient, situated close to the Hazratganj shopping area and right in front of Shahara Mall.

I would request you guys not to trust the ratings of this place and do not get duped by management.

text.text:
I chose Clarks Avadh to celebrate my 41st birthday, and I must admit, the experience did not disappoint. It’s a beautiful property where tradition blends seamlessly with modern comforts. The rooms are spacious, clean, and well-maintained, while the staff are exceptionally cordial and attentive.

What impressed me most was that they don’t just listen, but truly hear you out—with the genuine intention to resolve concerns or improve based on feedback. Special thanks to Mr. Aman, Mr. Prithvi, and the entire front office and reservations team for their eye for detail and thoughtful adjustments that made my stay extra special.

A heartfelt thank you for taking the effort to celebrate my birthday in such a warm and cozy way—I was truly touched.

Being one of the oldest 5-star properties in Lucknow, Clarks Avadh continues to treat its guests with a sense of royalty. Perfectly located in the heart of the city, it offers easy and convenient access to transportation, even late at night.

A wonderful choice for anyone seeking comfort, elegance, and hospitality that goes the extra mile.

text.text: I had the pleasure of staying at Regenta Central Lucknow last weekend, and it was truly a memorable experience. Whether you’re in town for business, leisure, or just passing through, this hotel has everything to offer for a comfortable and satisfying stay. The rooms were spacious, modern, and impeccably clean. The décor had a pleasant mix of traditional Lucknawi touches with contemporary comfort. My room had a fantastic view of the city, and the plush bedding ensured I had a restful night. The amenities provided were top-notch, including fast Wi-Fi, a well-stocked minibar, and a spacious bathroom with luxurious toiletries. The service at Regenta Central was exceptional. From the moment I arrived, the staff was warm, welcoming, and always attentive to my needs. Whether it was at the front desk or room service, I was consistently impressed by their professionalism and willingness to go the extra mile to ensure a pleasant stay.

text.text:
Radisson Hotel in Lucknow and had a pleasant experience overall. The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of the city, making it easy to access major attractions and business centers. The modern design of the hotel creates a welcoming atmosphere as soon as you step in.

Service: The staff at Radisson Lucknow were courteous and professional, always eager to assist with any requests. The check-in and check-out process was smooth and efficient. I particularly appreciated their prompt room service, which ensured that all my needs were met without delay.

Rooms: The room was spacious, clean, and well-appointed, with all the amenities you would expect from a Radisson property. The bed was comfortable, and the linens were of good quality. The bathroom was modern, with a great selection of toiletries and a powerful shower.

Dining: The hotel offers a variety of dining options. I had the chance to dine at their all-day restaurant, which served a good mix of local and international dishes. The breakfast buffet was particularly impressive, offering a wide selection of fresh and delicious options.

Amenities: The hotel boasts a well-equipped fitness center and a rooftop pool, both of which are perfect for unwinding after a long day. The pool area offers a great view of the city, which is an added bonus. The Wi-Fi was reliable throughout my stay, which was essential for my work.

text.text:
Been to this place in July 23 for night stay while driving towards Noida. First experience is something which everyone recalls. It was a good experience staying here although was a very short stay. The cuisine was sumptuous. Staff courtesy was excellent, which would push me to come back. The rooms could have been little bigger. Wasn’t expecting small room at Radisson Blu. The toiletries available were acceptable. Would love to come back for a longer stay whenever I am in Lucknow next time.

Edit after my visit in May25

My third stay at Radisson Lucknow City Centre, and once again, a truly comfortable experience.  The hotel's ambiance is inviting, making it a great choice for both business and leisure travelers.
The staff is incredibly helpful, with the front desk going the extra mile to arrange an on-call doctor during my personal emergency.
The range of food options available is impressive—flavorful, fresh, and generously portioned.
Rooms are well-maintained, offering a cozy and relaxing environment after a long day.
The hospitality remains consistently warm, ensuring a pleasant and seamless stay.
One area for improvement is the additional mattress provided—it could be more comfortable.
Timely refilling of buffet counters would enhance the dining experience further.
The location is convenient, allowing easy access to key city attractions.  Overall, a reliable and well-managed property that I look forward to visiting again.

text.text:
Exemplary Service and Genuine Hospitality AT FORTUNE PARK BBD - LUCKNOW, UP.

During my recent stay at FORTUNE PARK BBD LUCKNOW, I experienced exceptional service from a standout individual who truly made my visit memorable.

Upon arrival, I was warmly welcomed by Ms. SABINA & TEAM at the front desk. Their friendly demeanor and genuine interest in ensuring my comfort set a positive tone for the entire stay. They efficiently handled the check-in process, providing me with all necessary information about the hotel amenities and local attractions.

Throughout my stay, MS. SABINA & TEAM
Consistently demonstrated a high level of attentiveness and anticipation of my needs. They remembered my preferences for morning coffee and ensured it was delivered promptly to my room each day. Additionally, they offered valuable insights and recommendations for dining and activities in the area, enhancing my overall experiences!

What truly impressed me was the entire team, especially Ms. Sabina ability to add personal touches to my stay. They took the time to engage in friendly conversations, inquire about my day, and genuinely cared about my comfort and satisfaction. Their personalized attention made me feel valued as a guest and contributed significantly to the positive atmosphere of the hotel.

In conclusion, the exceptional service provided by the team at Fortune Park BBD was instrumental in making my stay memorable and enjoyable. Their professionalism, attentiveness, and genuine hospitality exemplify the high standards of customer service that set this hotel apart. I highly recommend Fortune Park BBD LUCKNOW to anyone seeking a personalized and welcoming experience.

Thank you MS. Sabina and Team

Regards,
Saran KPK

text.text:
Great Stay at Gemini Continental, Lucknow

I had a wonderful experience staying at Gemini Continental in Hazratganj, Lucknow. The hotel is conveniently located, with easy access to most major tourist spots. Autos and Totos are readily available right outside the hotel, making commuting hassle-free. Dastarkan, a popular restaurant, is just a 200-meter walk away, which was a great bonus.

I stayed for 3 nights in a fifth-floor premium room, and the room was spacious, well-maintained, and had a fantastic city view. The cleanliness of the rooms and restrooms was spot-on. The hotel staff was courteous and attentive, providing excellent service throughout my stay.

One of the highlights was the breakfast spread, which was diverse and offered both South and North Indian options. Whether you prefer dosas or parathas, there’s something for everyone. The hotel also offers ample parking, which is a plus in a busy area like Hazratganj.

Overall, I had a comfortable and pleasant stay at Gemini Continental. It’s a great option for both business and leisure travelers, offering good value for money with a convenient location, excellent amenities, and great service. Highly recommend it!

text.text:
Fantastic Stay at Hotel Casa, Aishbagh – A Perfect Blend of Comfort and Hospitality!
⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

We had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Casa, Aishbagh in Lucknow from 23rd to 25th June 2025, and it was truly a wonderful experience! From the moment we checked in, we were welcomed with warmth and professionalism by the courteous staff. The hospitality throughout our stay was top-notch, and every team member—from reception and housekeeping to the chefs and food & beverage staff—went above and beyond to ensure our comfort.

The rooms were clean, spacious, and well-maintained, offering a relaxing atmosphere after a long day. The ambience of the entire property is modern, inviting, and ideal for both business and leisure travelers.

We thoroughly enjoyed the delicious food served at their restaurant and bar, with a variety of options that catered to all tastes. Each meal was flavorful and beautifully presented. The staff was quick to respond to every query and request, showing genuine care and attention.

Another major plus is the location—the hotel is conveniently close to the railway station, making travel extremely easy. The property is also well-suited for business events, banquets, marriages, and other social functions, thanks to its excellent facilities and elegant event spaces.

We sincerely appreciate the hard work and dedication of everyone at Hotel Casa and would like to highly recommend this hotel to families, couples, solo travelers, and business guests alike. It was a memorable stay, and we look forward to visiting again!

text.text:
I stayed here on my recent visit to Lucknow from 16 - 19 Dec 2023. Stayed in an executive room 414 on the terrace and I must admit that although the hotel is very old and has signs of aging, the room that I stayed in was well kept and clean. The washroom was clean and functional. The bed had spring mattress and the sheets were clean. RO water is provided free of charge but bottled water is chargeable. The main USP of the hotel is the location which is comfortably close to the main hub of Hazratganj. Also the restaurant "Kool Break" on the ground floor of the hotel makes very tasty food. So all in all you get - great food, clean room and a well connected location. Five stars for the stay and the rate at which I stayed in the hotel. Suggestion to the hotel
1 - Switch to blinds or longer curtains for the window above the AC.
2. Also provide a complimentary water bottle per day - as that is a standard practice across all hotels.

text.text:
The Hotel is a Gem within the capital of UP. I had booked online two months ago hassle-free. Although a bit apprehensive about services. I was in for a great surprise upon arrival. Some of the salient features are as follows.
1. The surroundings of the hotel is typically busy Lucknow style but once inside you can feel the difference and are completely isolated and safe from chaotic outside.
2. The reception starting from security guard to front desk to chefs and roomboys are noteworthy.
3. The role of the staff especially the reception is praiseworthy in dealing with various aspects of costumer satisfaction.
4. The rooms were done up wonderfully upon arrival and all were professionally managed. I have been to various places and hotels but these services of Nexus needs special appreciation. All items, furniture, crockery, beds, bathroom and general cleaning was perfect in all aspects. Complacency was nowhere to be seen.
5. The kichen of Nexus needs special mention. They are prompt, professional, and discreet with perfect skills to manage your culinary request. Kudos to the men at work from 0800 to 2300 hrs relantanously. All the items ordered were having a great taste and professional touch. Prices are slightly on the higher side but good quality needs  sufficient remuneration. Keep it up.
6. The general cleaniness of Nexus is top notch. You will never notice any thing amiss in the surroundings. All are placed were it should have been.
7. The Nexus has good lift, nicely lit up alleyways, fire sensors (in every room) and speaker system on the floor  corridors.
8. My experience with staying here for four complete days seems to be out of world experience for me.
9. Although I preferred quoting names of individual staffs for there dedication in keeping up the hotel's reputation, I refrained owing to privacy. But anyway the reception, kitchen and the management needs special appreciation in all respects.
10. Thanks for the wonderful stay and looking forward for my continuous association and frequent friends and family referrals from my side.
KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK.  With best wishes. - Vinod

text.text: Hotel is located right opposite to Saharaganj mall which is good. Main Hazratganj, lalbagh and other area are walkable. Metro station is walkable. station is within 5km I guess. I had booked the starting room which is very compact. Cleanliness is average. Room service is quick. Food charges in room service will beat 5 star hotels. Imagine one plate of daal 350 Rs and taxes. Staff is polite, good to talk but not professional. It's basically a banquet hotel good for parties and marriages. If you are staying during wedding season and plan to sleep peacefully or work from your room then not possible. Party halls are at the same floor where the rooms are. Bathtub was dirty and linen and towels were average clean. One can stay not a problem but don't expect much other than location.
